db:abstract.db:para: The QVideoFrameFormat class specifies the stream format of a video presentation surface.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A video sink presents a stream of video frames. QVideoFrameFormat describes the type of the frames and determines how they should be presented.
The core properties of a video stream required to set up a video sink are the pixel format given by pixelFormat(), and the frame dimensions given by frameSize().

The region of a frame that is actually displayed on a video surface is given by the viewport(). A stream may have a viewport less than the entire region of a frame to allow for videos smaller than the nearest optimal size of a video frame. For example the width of a frame may be extended so that the start of each scan line is eight byte aligned.
Other common properties are the scanLineDirection(), frameRate() and the yCrCbColorSpace().

db:section.db:title: enum QVideoFrameFormat::ColorRange
db:section.db:para: Describes the color range used by the video data. Video data usually comes in either full color range, where all values are being used, or a more limited range traditionally used in YUV video formats, where a subset of all values is being used.

db:td.db:para: The color range of the video is unknown.

db:section.db:para: The color range traditionally used by most YUV video formats. For 8 bit formats, the Y component is limited to values between 16 and 235. The U and V components are limited to values between 16 and 240
For higher bit depths multiply these values with 2^(depth-8).
Full color range. All values from 0 to 2^depth - 1 are valid.

db:section.db:title: enum QVideoFrameFormat::ColorSpace
db:section.db:para: Enumerates the color space of video frames.

db:td.db:para: No color space is specified.
A color space defined by ITU-R recommendation BT.601 with Y value range from 16 to 235, and Cb/Cr range from 16 to 240. Used mostly by older videos that were targeting CRT displays.
A color space defined by ITU-R BT.709 with the same values range as ColorSpace_BT601. The most commonly used color space today.
The full range YUV color space used in most JPEG files.
The color space defined by ITU-R BT.2020. Used mainly for HDR videos.
The color transfer function is unknown.

Color values are encoded according to BT709. See also https://www.itu.int/rec/R-REC-BT.709/en. This is close to, but not identical to a gamma curve of 2.2, and the same transfer curve as is used in sRGB.
Color values are encoded according to BT601. See also https://www.itu.int/rec/R-REC-BT.601/en.
Color values are linear
Color values are encoded with a gamma of 2.2
Color values are encoded with a gamma of 2.8

Color values are encoded using STME ST 2084. This transfer function is the most common HDR transfer function and often called the 'perceptual quantizer'. See also https://www.itu.int/rec/R-REC-BT.2100 and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perceptual_quantizer.

Color values are encoded using ARIB STD B67. This transfer function is also often referred to as 'hybrid log gamma'. See also https://www.itu.int/rec/R-REC-BT.2100 and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hybrid_logâ€“gamma.

db:section.db:title: enum QVideoFrameFormat::Direction
db:section.db:para: Enumerates the layout direction of video scan lines.

db:td.db:para: Scan lines are arranged from the top of the frame to the bottom.
Scan lines are arranged from the bottom of the frame to the top.

db:section.db:title: enum QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat
db:section.db:para: Enumerates video data types.

db:td.db:para: The frame is invalid.
The frame is stored using a ARGB format with 8 bits per component.
The frame stored using a premultiplied ARGB format with 8 bits per component.
The frame stored using a 32 bits per pixel RGB format (0xff, R, G, B).
The frame is stored using a 32-bit BGRA format (0xBBGGRRAA).
The frame is stored using a premultiplied 32bit BGRA format.
The frame is stored using a 32-bit ABGR format (0xAABBGGRR).
The frame is stored using a 32-bit BGR format (0xffBBGGRR).
The frame is stored in memory as the bytes R, G, B, A/X, with R at the lowest address and A/X at the highest address.
The frame is stored in format 32-bit BGRx format, [31:0] B:G:R:x 8:8:8:8 little endian
The frame is stored in memory as the bytes R, G, B, A/X, with R at the lowest address and A/X at the highest address.
The frame is stored using a packed 32-bit AYUV format (0xAAYYUUVV).
The frame is stored using a packed premultiplied 32-bit AYUV format (0xAAYYUUVV).

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, i.e. the height and width of the U and V planes are half that of the Y plane.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally sub-sampled, i.e. the width of the U and V planes are half that of the Y plane, and height of U and V planes is the same as Y.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YVU format with the V and U planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, i.e. the height and width of the V and U planes are half that of the Y plane.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component packed YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally sub-sampled (U-Y-V-Y), i.e. two horizontally adjacent pixels are stored as a 32-bit macropixel which has a Y value for each pixel and common U and V values.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component packed YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally sub-sampled (Y-U-Y-V), i.e. two horizontally adjacent pixels are stored as a 32-bit macropixel which has a Y value for each pixel and common U and V values.
The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component semi-planar YUV format with a Y plane (Y) followed by a horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, packed UV plane (U-V).
The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component semi-planar YUV format with a Y plane (Y) followed by a horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, packed VU plane (V-U).

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled. This is similar to the Format_YUV420P type, except that the bytes per line of the U and V planes are padded out to the same stride as the Y plane.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YUV format with the U and V planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled. This is similar to the Format_YUV420P type, except that the lines of the U and V planes are interleaved, i.e. each line of U data is followed by a line of V data creating a single line of the same stride as the Y data.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YVU format with the V and U planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled. This is similar to the Format_YV12 type, except that the bytes per line of the V and U planes are padded out to the same stride as the Y plane.

The frame is stored using an 8-bit per component planar YVU format with the V and U planes horizontally and vertically sub-sampled. This is similar to the Format_YV12 type, except that the lines of the V and U planes are interleaved, i.e. each line of V data is followed by a line of U data creating a single line of the same stride as the Y data.

The frame is stored using a 16bit per component semi-planar YUV format with a Y plane (Y) followed by a horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, packed UV plane (U-V). Only the 10 most significant bits of each component are being used.
The frame is stored using a 16bit per component semi-planar YUV format with a Y plane (Y) followed by a horizontally and vertically sub-sampled, packed UV plane (U-V).
The frame is stored using an 8-bit greyscale format.
The frame is stored using a 16-bit linear greyscale format. Little endian.
The frame is stored in compressed Jpeg format.
The frame is stored in external OES texture format. This is currently only being used on Android.

The frame is stored in rectangle texture format (GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE). This is only being used on macOS with an OpenGL based Rendering Hardware interface. The underlying pixel format stored in the texture is Format_BRGA8888.
Similar to YUV420, but uses 16bits per component, 10 of those significant.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::QVideoFrameFormat()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null video stream format.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::QVideoFrameFormat(const QSize &size, QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat format)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a video stream with the given frame size and pixel format.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::QVideoFrameFormat(const QVideoFrameFormat &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::QVideoFrameFormat(QVideoFrameFormat &&other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QVideoFrameFormat by moving from other.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::~QVideoFrameFormat()
db:section.db:para: Destroys a video stream description.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::ColorRange QVideoFrameFormat::colorRange() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the color range that should be used to render the video stream.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::ColorSpace QVideoFrameFormat::colorSpace() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the color space of a video stream.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::ColorTransfer QVideoFrameFormat::colorTransfer() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the color transfer function that should be used to render the video stream.

db:section.db:title: int QVideoFrameFormat::frameHeight() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the height of frame in a video stream.

db:section.db:title: qreal QVideoFrameFormat::frameRate() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the frame rate of a video stream in frames per second.

db:section.db:title: QSize QVideoFrameFormat::frameSize() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the dimensions of frames in a video stream.

db:section.db:title: int QVideoFrameFormat::frameWidth() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the width of frames in a video stream.

db:section.db:title: [static] QImage::Format QVideoFrameFormat::imageFormatFromPixelFormat(QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat format)
db:section.db:para: Returns an image format equivalent to a video frame pixel format. If there is no equivalent format QImage::Format_Invalid is returned instead.

db:note.db:para: In general QImage does not handle YUV formats.

db:section.db:title: bool QVideoFrameFormat::isMirrored() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the surface is mirrored around its vertical axis. This is typically needed for video frames coming from a front camera of a mobile device.

db:note.db:para: The mirroring here differs from QImage::mirrored, as a vertically mirrored QImage will be mirrored around its x-axis.

db:section.db:title: bool QVideoFrameFormat::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Identifies if a video surface format has a valid pixel format and frame size.
Returns true if the format is valid, and false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat QVideoFrameFormat::pixelFormat() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the pixel format of frames in a video stream.

db:section.db:title: [static] QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat QVideoFrameFormat::pixelFormatFromImageFormat(QImage::Format format)
db:section.db:para: Returns a video pixel format equivalent to an image format. If there is no equivalent format QVideoFrameFormat::Format_Invalid is returned instead.

db:note.db:para: In general QImage does not handle YUV formats.

db:section.db:title: [static] QString QVideoFrameFormat::pixelFormatToString(QVideoFrameFormat::PixelFormat pixelFormat)
db:section.db:para: Returns a string representation of the given pixelFormat.

db:section.db:title: int QVideoFrameFormat::planeCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of planes used. This number is depending on the pixel format and is 1 for RGB based formats, and a number between 1 and 3 for YUV based formats.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::Direction QVideoFrameFormat::scanLineDirection() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the direction of scan lines.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setColorRange(QVideoFrameFormat::ColorRange range)
db:section.db:para: Sets the color transfer range that should be used to render the video stream to range.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setColorSpace(QVideoFrameFormat::ColorSpace colorSpace)
db:section.db:para: Sets the colorSpace of a video stream.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setColorTransfer(QVideoFrameFormat::ColorTransfer colorTransfer)
db:section.db:para: Sets the color transfer function that should be used to render the video stream to colorTransfer.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setFrameRate(qreal rate)
db:section.db:para: Sets the frame rate of a video stream in frames per second.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setFrameSize(const QSize &size)
db:section.db:para: Sets the size of frames in a video stream to size.
This will reset the viewport() to fill the entire frame.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setFrameSize(int width, int height)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Sets the width and height of frames in a video stream.
This will reset the viewport() to fill the entire frame.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setMaxLuminance(float lum)
db:section.db:para: Sets the maximum luminance to the given value, lum.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setMirrored(bool mirrored)
db:section.db:para: Sets if the surface is mirrored around its vertical axis. This is typically needed for video frames coming from a front camera of a mobile device. Default value is false.

db:note.db:para: The mirroring here differs from QImage::mirrored, as a vertically mirrored QImage will be mirrored around its x-axis.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setScanLineDirection(QVideoFrameFormat::Direction direction)
db:section.db:para: Sets the direction of scan lines.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setViewport(const QRect &viewport)
db:section.db:para: Sets the viewport of a video stream to viewport.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::swap(QVideoFrameFormat &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps the current video frame format with the other.

db:section.db:title: QRect QVideoFrameFormat::viewport() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the viewport of a video stream.
The viewport is the region of a video frame that is actually displayed.
By default the viewport covers an entire frame.

db:section.db:title: bool QVideoFrameFormat::operator!=(const QVideoFrameFormat &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other is different to this video format, and false if they are the same.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat &QVideoFrameFormat::operator=(QVideoFrameFormat &&other)
db:section.db:para: Moves other into this QVideoFrameFormat.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat &QVideoFrameFormat::operator=(const QVideoFrameFormat &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns the values of other to this object.

db:section.db:title: bool QVideoFrameFormat::operator==(const QVideoFrameFormat &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other is the same as this video format, and false if they are different.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QVideoFrameFormat
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QVideoFrameFormat are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: enum QVideoFrameFormat::YCbCrColorSpace
db:section.db:para: This enum is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use QVideoFrameFormat::ColorSpace instead.
Enumerates the Y'CbCr color space of video frames.

db:td.db:para: No color space is specified.
A Y'CbCr color space defined by ITU-R recommendation BT.601 with Y value range from 16 to 235, and Cb/Cr range from 16 to 240. Used mostly by older videos that were targeting CRT displays.
A Y'CbCr color space defined by ITU-R BT.709 with the same values range as YCbCr_BT601. The most commonly used color space today.

This value is deprecated. Please check the ColorRange instead. The BT.601 color space with the value range extended to 0 to 255. It is backward compatible with BT.601 and uses values outside BT.601 range to represent a wider range of colors.
This value is deprecated. Please check the ColorRange instead. The BT.709 color space with the value range extended to 0 to 255.
The full range Y'CbCr color space used in most JPEG files.
The color space defined by ITU-R BT.2020. Used mainly for HDR videos.

db:section.db:title: void QVideoFrameFormat::setYCbCrColorSpace(QVideoFrameFormat::YCbCrColorSpace space)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use setColorSpace() instead
Sets the Y'CbCr color space of a video stream. It is only used with raw YUV frame types.

db:section.db:title: QVideoFrameFormat::YCbCrColorSpace QVideoFrameFormat::yCbCrColorSpace() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use colorSpace() instead
Returns the Y'CbCr color space of a video stream.
